title: Head of State in Nigeria and Mexico

content.question: Which of the following best explains the effect of the presidentâ€™s combined role as both head of state and head of government in countries such as Nigeria and Mexico?

choices.label: The president is responsible for both executing the laws and representing the state.
The president both acts as the chief executive and serves in the legislature, which facilitates policy making.
The president has a smaller role in foreign policy due to the combination of the roles of head of state and head of government.
The president has more independence from the demands of political parties and coalitions.

content.answer: The president is responsible for both executing the laws and representing the state.
